conclusion: To solve for the magnetic induction B, we will follow these steps
Since the particle is injected at an angle of 45 degrees, the initial velocity components are
Horizontal component: v0x = v0 cos(45 degrees) = v0/sqrt(2)
Vertical component: v0y = v0 sin(45 degrees) = v0/sqrt(2)
After collision with the plate, the horizontal velocity reverses but maintains its magnitude
The new horizontal component is -v0/sqrt(2), while the vertical component remains v0/sqrt(2)
The particle moves in a circular path in the magnetic field
The radius r of the circular path is given by the relation r = mv/qB
Where m is the mass of the particle, q is the charge of the particle, v is the speed of the particle
The speed of the particle v is v = sqrt(v0x^2 + v0y^2) = v0
The radius r is r = mv0/qB
From the diagram, the distance from point c to point f is 2d horizontally
Given that the particle makes a 45 degree angle with MN, the distance along the trajectory forms a triangle with the radius 2r as the hypotenuse
Using trigonometry: 2d = r sin(45 degrees) = r/sqrt(2)
Substitute r = 2d sqrt(2) into the equation for r: 2d sqrt(2) = mv0/qB
The magnitude of the magnetic induction B is B = mv0/(2d sqrt(2) q)
